Reference

Basic Functions

Functions that are basic.

add_clause()

Add a new clause to the current contract

add_counterparty() has_counterparty() get_counterparty()

Add a counterparty to a contract

add_date_term()

Add a new date term to the current contract

add_maturity()

Add a maturity date to a contract

add_term()

Overall wrapper for adding a new term to the current contract

make_clause()

Overall wrapper to make new clause objects

make_contract()

Create a tidy financial contract object

print(<contract>)

Print a Contract

starting_from()

Add a start date to a contract

Functions for adding events

add_clause()

add_maturity()

Add a maturity date to a contract

add_term()

Overall wrapper for adding a new term to the current contract

Placeholders

contractr allows you to input placeholders for terms in a contract that are not yet known.

add_clause()

Add a new clause to the current contract

Add a counterparty to a contract

Add a new date term to the current contract

Creating custom clauses

These fuctions can be used if you want to add new types of clauses or terms.

add_date_term()

Add a new date term to the current contract

make_clause()

Overall wrapper to make new clause objects

add_clause()

Add a new clause to the current contract
